newsitem.title: USA: U.S. OPTIONS FOCUS/Tech stocks ahead of indicator.
newsitem.headline: U.S. OPTIONS FOCUS/Tech stocks ahead of indicator.

text.p: Options on shares of some semiconductor stocks highlighted trading on Tuesday as investors placed their bets ahead of the release of a key industry barometer, traders said.

The Semiconductor Industry Association's monthly book-to-bill ratio for August is expected to be released after the stock market close on Tuesday, traders said. The report was originally expected to be released on Monday.
Analysts expect the ratio to be between 0.86 and 0.92, up from 0.85 in July.
"I think you're seeing a lot of activity before the book-to-bill," said Jesse Stamer, a general partner at TradeNet.
He added that a comment from International Business Machines Corp that it was seeing strong demand for its new mainframe computers contributed to activity in technology stocks and their options.
Among the options drawing attention were Intel Corp, Micron Technology Inc and Altera Corp.
Options on other technology stocks, including IBM, Dell Computer Corp and Compaq Computer Corp also were active, continuing a trend seen on Monday, traders said.
On the Pacific Stock Exchange, the Altera October 50 call, with an open interest of 113 through Monday, traded 1,700 contracts.
One trade of 1,000 contracts crossed in early afternoon. at 15/16, its high for the day. By 1415 CDT (1915 GMT), the option was up 1/2 at 7/8. Altera shares rallied 2-3/8 to 41-7/8.
Intel puts and calls were active on American Stock Exchange, led by September 85 call, which traded 3,545 contracts.
Other active Intel options included the September 80 call, the October 85 call and the October 70 put.
Micron Technology, which was up 3/4 at 21-3/8, had a couple active put options on the Pacific Stock Exchange.
The Micron October 20 put traded about 800 contracts and the September 22-1/2 put traded 325.

On the CBOE, the Micron January 1997 20 put traded 100 contracts, 90 of which was part of a spread, traders said. The January 1997 17-1/2 call traded 136. Dell Computer had several active options on the Philadelphia Stock Exchange but most of the volume was done in small lots, traders said.
The Dell September 70 put traded nearly 1,000 contracts, the September 55 put traded 228 and the October 70 call traded nearly 700.
IBM, which has typically active options, had the most active puts and calls on the CBOE. IBM shares were up 1/4 at 117-7/8 in late trade after hitting 119-3/8 intraday.
